## Diagram

Diagram Class

### Parameters

-   `options` **[TypeDiagramOptions][73]** 

### htmlId

id of DIV that diagram is tied to

Type: [string][74]

### addElements

Add elements to diagram

#### Parameters

-   `elementsToAdd` **[Array][75]&lt;TypeAddElementObject>** array of element definitions
-   `collection` **DiagramElementCollection** the collection to add elements to (optional, default `this.elements`)
-   `addElementsKey` **[string][74]** key to add elements (optional, default `'addElements'`)

#### Examples

```javascript
diagram.addElements([
  { name: 'shape1', method: 'polygon', options: { position: [0, 0] } },
  { name: 'shape2', method: 'polygon', options: { position: [1, 1] } },
]);
```

## Equations




### Types




#### TypeEquationPhrase

An equation phrase is used to define an equation form. An equation phrase
can either be the entirety of the form definition, or a series of nested
phrases.

-   An object or array definition (e.g. [TypeFracObject][11] or [TypeFracArray][13])
-   A string that represents an equation element
-   An array of [TypeEquationPhrase][9]

Type: ([string][74] \| [number][76] | {frac: [TypeFracObject][77]} | [TypeFracArray][78] | {strike: TypeStrikeObject} | TypeStrikeArray | {box: TypeBoxObject} | TypeBoxArray | {root: TypeRootObject} | TypeRootArray | {brac: TypeBracketObject} | TypeBracketArray | {sub: TypeSubObject} | TypeSubArray | {sup: TypeSupObject} | TypeSupArray | {supSub: TypeSupSubObject} | TypeSupSubArray | {topBar: TypeBarObject} | TypeBarArray | {bottomBar: TypeBarObject} | TypeBarArray | {annotate: TypeAnnotateObject} | {topComment: TypeCommentObject} | TypeCommentArray | {bottomComment: TypeCommentObject} | TypeCommentArray | {padding: TypePaddingObject} | TypePaddingArray | {bar: TypeBarObject} | TypeBarArray | {scale: TypeScaleObject} | TypeScaleArray | {container: TypeContainerObject} | TypeContainerArray | {matrix: TypeMatrixObject} | TypeMatrixArray | [Array][75]&lt;[TypeEquationPhrase][79]> | DiagramElementPrimitive | DiagramElementCollection | Elements | [Element][80] | BaseAnnotationFunction)

##### Examples

```javascript
:
forms: {
  form1: 'a'
  form2: ['a', 'equals', 'b']
  form3: [{
    frac: {
      numerator: 'a',
      symbol: 'v',
      denominator: '1'
    },
  }, 'equals', 'b'],
  form4: [{ frac: ['a', 'v', '1'], 'equals', 'b'}],
},
```

#### TypeFracObject

Fraction object definition

Type: {numerator: [TypeEquationPhrase][79], symbol: [string][74], denominator: [TypeEquationPhrase][79], scale: [number][76]?, numeratorSpace: [number][76]?, denominatorSpace: [number][76]?, overhang: [number][76]?, offsetY: [number][76]?, fullContentBounds: [boolean][81]?}

##### Properties

-   `symbol` **[number][76]?** Vinculum symbol
-   `overhang` **[number][76]?** How far the vinculum extends beyond the content
-   `offsetY` **[number][76]?** Offset the fraction in y
-   `numerator` **[TypeEquationPhrase][79]** 
-   `denominator` **[TypeEquationPhrase][79]** 
-   `scale` **[number][76]?** 
-   `numeratorSpace` **[number][76]?** 
-   `denominatorSpace` **[number][76]?** 
-   `fullContentBounds` **[boolean][81]?** 

#### TypeFracArray

Fraction array definition

Array order: numerator, symbol, denominator, scale, numeratorSpace,
  denominatorSpace, overhang, offsetY, fullContentBounds

Once an optional element is left out, then all subsequent elements must
also be left out

Type: \[[TypeEquationPhrase][79], [string][74], [TypeEquationPhrase][79], [number][76]?, [number][76]?, [number][76]?, [number][76]?, [number][76]?, [boolean][81]?]

#### TypeEquationElement

Definition of a text or symbol equation element. Symbol properties take
receive priority over text properties, so if 'symbol' is defined, then 'text'
will be ignored.

Type: ([string][74] | {text: [string][74]?, font: DiagramFont?, style: (`"italic"` \| `"normal"` | null)?, symbol: [string][74]?, numLines: [number][76]?, side: (`"top"` \| `"left"` \| `"bottom"` \| `"right"`)?, color: [Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>?, mods: {}?} | DiagramElementPrimitive | DiagramElementCollection)

##### Properties

-   `text` **[string][74]?** Text element only
-   `font` **DiagramFont?** Text element only
-   `style` **(`"italic"` \| `"normal"`)?** Text element only
-   `symbol` **[string][74]?** Symbol element only
-   `side` **(`"top"` \| `"left"` \| `"bottom"` \| `"right"`)?** Symbol element only
-   `mods` **[object][82]?** Properties to set on instantiated element
-   `color` **[Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>?** Color to set the element

#### TypeEquationElements

Object with multiple equation elements.

Type: {}

#### TypeFormAlignment

Defines how to align a form

Type: {fixTo: (DiagramElementPrimitive | DiagramElementCollection | [Point][83]), xAlign: TypeHAlign, yAlign: TypeVAlign}

##### Properties

-   `fixTo` **(DiagramElementPrimitive | DiagramElementCollection | [Point][83])** 
-   `xAlign` **TypeHAlign** 
-   `yAlign` **TypeVAlign** 

#### TypeEquationFormObject

Form definition object

Type: {content: [TypeEquationPhrase][79], subForm: [string][74]?, scale: [number][76]?, alignment: [TypeFormAlignment][84]?, description: [string][74]?, modifiers: {}?, fromPrev: {duration: [number][76]??, translation: {}?}?, fromNext: {duration: [number][76]??, translation: {}?}?, duration: [number][76]??, translation: {}?, elementMods: {}?}

##### Properties

-   `content` **[TypeEquationPhrase][79]** 
-   `subForm` **[string][74]?** 
-   `scale` **[number][76]?** 
-   `alignment` **[TypeFormAlignment][84]?** 
-   `description` **[string][74]?** 
-   `modifiers` **{}?** 
-   `fromPrev` **{duration: [number][76]??, translation: {}?}?** 
-   `fromNext` **{duration: [number][76]??, translation: {}?}?** 
-   `duration` **[number][76]??** 
-   `translation` **{}?** 
-   `elementMods` **{}?** 

#### TypeEquationForm

Single form definition

Type: ([TypeEquationPhrase][79] \| [TypeEquationFormObject][85] | {})

#### TypeEquationOptions

Equation options

Type: {color: [Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>?, fontMath: DiagramFont?, position: [Point][83]?, scale: [number][76]?, defaultFormAlignment: [TypeFormAlignment][84]?, elements: [TypeEquationElements][86]?, forms: [TypeEquationForms][87]?, formSeries: ([Array][75]&lt;[string][74]> | {})?, defaultFormSeries: [string][74]?, formRestart: {moveFrom: ([Point][83]? | DiagramElementCollection)?, pulse: {duration: [number][76]?, scale: [number][76]?, element: DiagramElement??}?}?}

##### Properties

-   `color` **[Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>?** 
-   `fontMath` **DiagramFont?** 
-   `position` **[Point][83]?** 
-   `scale` **[number][76]?** 
-   `defaultFormAlignment` **[TypeFormAlignment][84]?** 
-   `elements` **[TypeEquationElements][86]?** 
-   `forms` **[TypeEquationForms][87]?** 
-   `formSeries` **([Array][75]&lt;[string][74]> | {})?** 
-   `defaultFormSeries` **[string][74]?** 
-   `formRestart` **{moveFrom: ([Point][83]? | DiagramElementCollection)?, pulse: {duration: [number][76]?, scale: [number][76]?, element: DiagramElement??}?}?** 

## tools

These are generic tools


### g2

2D geometry tools


#### Point

Point class

##### Parameters

-   `x` **[number][76]** x coordinate of point
-   `y` **[number][76]** y coordinate of point

##### x

x value of point

Type: [number][76]

##### y

y value of point

Type: [number][76]

##### \_dup

Return a duplicate of the [Point][26] object

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### scale

Scale x and y values of point by scalar

###### Parameters

-   `scalar` **[number][76]** 

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(1, 1);
s = p.scale(3);
// s = Point{x: 3, y: 3};
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### sub

Subtract (x, y) values or a [Point][26] and return the difference as a new [Point][26]

###### Parameters

-   `pointOrX` **([Point][83] \| [number][76])** 
-   `y` **[number][76]**  (optional, default `0`)

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(3, 3);
d = p.sub(1, 1)
// d = Point{x: 2, y: 2}

p = new Point(3, 3);
q = new Point(1, 1);
d = p.sub(q)
// d = Point{x: 2, y: 2}
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### add

Add (x, y) values or a [Point][26] and return the sum as a new [Point][26]

###### Parameters

-   `pointOrX` **([Point][83] \| [number][76])** 
-   `y` **[number][76]**  (optional, default `0`)

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(3, 3);
d = p.add(1, 1)
// d = Point{x: 4, y: 4}

p = new Point(3, 3);
q = new Point(1, 1);
d = p.add(q)
// d = Point{x: 4, y: 4}
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### distance

Return the distance between the point and the origin

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(1, 1);
d = p.distance();
// d = 1.4142135623730951
```

Returns **[number][76]** 

##### round

Return a new point with (x, y) values rounded to some precision

###### Parameters

-   `precision` **[number][76]**  (optional, default `8`)

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(1.234, 1.234);
q = p.round(2);
// q = Point{x: 1.23, y: 1.23}
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### clip

Return a new point that is clipped to min and max values from the origin.

Use a point as a parameter to define different (x, y) min/max values,
a number to define the same (x, y) min/max values, or null to have no
min/max values.

###### Parameters

-   `min` **([Point][83] \| [number][76] | null)** 
-   `max` **([Point][83] \| [number][76] | null)** 

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(2, 2);
q = p.clip(1, 1);
// q = Point{x: 1, y: 1}

p = new Point(2, 2);
q = p.clip(1, null);
// q = Point{x: 1, y: 2}

p = new Point(-2, -2);
minClip = new Point(-1, -1.5);
q = p.clip(minClip, null);
// q = Point{x: -1, y: -1.5}
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### transformBy

Transform the point with a 3x3 matrix (2 dimensional transform)

###### Parameters

-   `matrix` **[Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>** 

###### Examples

```javascript
// Transform a point with a (2, 2) translation then 90ยบ rotation
p = new Point(1, 1);
m = new Transform().translate(2, 2).rotate(Math.PI / 2).matrix();
// m = [0, -1, -2, 1, 0, 2, 0, 0, 1]
q = p.transformBy(m)
// q = Point{x: -3, y: 3}
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### rotate

Rotate a point some angle around a center point

###### Parameters

-   `angle` **[number][76]** in radians
-   `center` **[Point][83]**  (optional, default `new Point(0,0)`)

###### Examples

```javascript
// Rotate a point around the origin
p = new Point(1, 0);
q = p.rotate(Math.PI)
// q = Point{x: -1, y: 0}

// Rotate a point around (1, 1)
p = new Point(2, 1);
q = p.rotate(Math.PI, new Point(1, 1))
// q = Point{x: 0, y: 1}
```

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### isEqualTo

Compare two points for equality to some precision

###### Parameters

-   `p` **[Point][83]** 
-   `precision` **[number][76]**  (optional, default `8`)

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(1.123, 1.123);
q = new Point(1.124, 1.124);
p.isEqualTo(q)
// false

p.isEqualTo(q, 2)
// true
```

##### isNotEqualTo

Compare two points for unequality to some precision

###### Parameters

-   `p` **[Point][83]** 
-   `precision` **[number][76]?** 

###### Examples

```javascript
p = new Point(1.123, 1.123);
q = new Point(1.124, 1.124);
p.isNotEqualTo(q)
// true

p.isNotEqualTo(q, 2)
// false
```

##### zero

Return a point at (0, 0)

Returns **[Point][83]** 

##### Unity

Return a point at (1, 1)

Returns **[Point][83]** 

#### Rect

Rect

##### Parameters

-   `left` **[number][76]** left location
-   `bottom` **[number][76]** rectangle height
-   `width` **[number][76]** rectangle width
-   `height` **[number][76]** 

### range

Creates an array with a range of number

#### Parameters

-   `start` **[number][76]** Range start
-   `stop` **[number][76]** Range stop
-   `step` **[number][76]** Range step (optional, default `1`)

Returns **[Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>** Range of numbers in an array

## tools

Tools object that is so great

### Properties

-   `math` **[object][82]** Math tools
-   `g2` **[object][82]** 2D geometry tools
-   `color` **[object][82]** Color tools
-   `css` **[object][82]** CSS tools

## round

Rounds a number or numbers in an array

### Parameters

-   `arrayOrValue` **([number][76] \| [Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>)** Value or array of values to be rounded
-   `precision` **[number][76]** Number of decimal places to round to (optional, default `5`)

Returns **([number][76] \| [Array][75]&lt;[number][76]>)** Rounded value or array of values

## TypeDiagramOptions

Diagram Input Options

Type: {htmlId: [string][74]?, limits: [Rect][88]?}

### Properties

-   `htmlId` **[string][74]?** HTML div tag id - default: 'figureOneId'
-   `limits` **[Rect][88]** Diagram coordinate limits - default: bottom left
     corner at (-1, -1), width 1, height 1
